quiz.question: What is a common reason countries adjust their time zones historically?

If it is 6 PM in Los Angeles (UTC-8 standard), what time is it in New York (UTC-5 standard)?
What rare adjustment adds a second to UTC to align atomic clocks with Earth's rotation?
Which airline/time-industry standard uses the letter 'Z' to denote UTC?
What is the typical length of one time zone in degrees of longitude?
What major change did Russia implement in 2011 related to clocks?
Which municipality uniquely observes a different time zone than its surrounding region for commerce reasons in the U.S.?
Which term describes adjusting clocks backward one hour at the end of DST?
Which country uses UTC+4:30 as its official time?
Which legal instrument in the UK originally defined Greenwich Mean Time as the legal time of Great Britain?
How many hours ahead is Tokyo (UTC+9) from London (UTC+0)?
Which region observes the world's easternmost time zone at UTC+14?
Which historical convention set the day starting at midnight worldwide for civil purposes?
